thread.title: Democrats acknowledge Black Lives Matter during debate
thread.title_full: Democrats acknowledge Black Lives Matter during debate

title: Democrats acknowledge Black Lives Matter during debate
text: > South Carolina Democrats acknowledge Black Lives Matter during debate In this Oct. 13, 2015, photo, Democratic presidential candidates from left, former Virginia Sen. Jim Webb, Sen. Bernie Sanders, I-Vt., Hillary Rodham Clinton, former Maryland Gov. Martin O'Malley, and former Rhode Island Gov. Lincoln Chafee take the stage before the CNN Democratic presidential debate in Las Vegas. Democratic presidential candidates gave a meaningful public nod to the Black Lives Matter movement in their first televised debate. The candidates invoked its slogan and raised the core concerns stemming from police killings of African-Americans. Protesters have articulated those concerns in disrupting some of the candidatesâ€™ campaign events. (AP Photo/David Becker)
